revised_title: Meteorological Perturbations of Tides and Currents in a Rotating Channel
tldr: This article investigates the effects of meteorological disturbances on tides and currents in an unlimited channel rotating with the Earth. The authors develop equations of motion and boundary conditions to analyze the impact of wind and atmospheric pressure on the water's surface elevation and current components. They consider the establishment of a steady state and the decay of initial disturbances, providing insights into the behavior of ocean currents and tides under various meteorological conditions.
